meanings.definition: To view or present in a romantic way
meanings.sent1: She likes to romanticize old love stories.
meanings.sent2: Don't romanticize the past too much; reality is important too.
meanings.sent3: He tends to romanticize even the simplest gestures.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings romanticize the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent5: In her mind, she would always romanticize their first date.

meanings.definition: To make something seem more attractive or idealized than it really is
meanings.sent1: He tends to romanticize his achievements.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to romanticize the idea of living in a big city.
meanings.sent3: She always romanticizes the taste of her homemade cookies.
meanings.sent4: The advertisement tried to romanticize the benefits of the product.
meanings.sent5: Don't romanticize the difficulties of starting a business; it takes hard work.
